info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 2:39PM EDT until March 25 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 239 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Miami Beach, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Miami Shores, North Bay Village, El Portal, Little Haiti, Liberty City, Gladeview, Pinewood, West Little River, Westview, Golden Glades, Miami International Airport, Bay Harbor Islands and Biscayne Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
